revision.comment: + [[List_of_one-hit_wonders_in_the_United_States#1960s|List of 1960s one-hit wonders in the United States]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox song | name = Everyone's Gone to the Moon | cover = | alt = | type = single | artist = [[Jonathan King]] | album = Or Then Again... | B-side = Summer's Coming | released = [[1965 in music|1965]] | format = | recorded = | studio = | venue = | genre = [[Pop music|Pop]] | length = 2:23 | label = [[Decca Records]] (UK)
[[Parrot Records]] (US and Canada) | writer = [[Jonathan King]] | producer = Jonathan King | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = Let It All Hang Out | next_year = 1966 }} "'''Everyone's Gone to the Moon'''" is a song that was written and recorded as the debut single of the British [[singer-songwriter]] and [[record producer]] [[Jonathan King]]. The song was released in 1965 while King was still an undergraduate at [[Cambridge University]].{{citation |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Z4kOlbCN9t0C&pg=PA186 |title= At the Water's Edge - Essays in Faith and Morals |author=William L. Roth|work=Books.google.co.uk|accessdate=2015-11-28|isbn= 9780967158716 |year= 2001 }} Released by [[Decca Records]], it reached No. 4 in the UK,{{cite book| first= Graham| last= Betts| year=2004| title= Complete UK Hit Singles 1952-2004| edition= 1st|publisher= Collins| location= London| isbn= 0-00-717931-6| page=425}} and No. 17 in the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]].{{citation |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=NDUGbT9d4hcC |page=43 |title=99 Red Balloons...and 100 Other All-Time Great One-Hit Wonders |author=Brent Mann|work=Books.google.co.uk|accessdate=2015-11-28|isbn=9780806525167 |year=2003 }}{{cite news |url= https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2005/mar/29/ukcrime.childprotection1 |title=The rise and fall of a pop tsar |agency=Press Association |date=29 March 2005 |newspaper=The Guardian |location =London}} ==See also== * [[List_of_one-hit_wonders_in_the_United_States#1960s|List of 1960s one-hit wonders in the United States]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.kingofhits.co.uk/index.php/Biography.html Jonathan King official website] *[http://www.65mylifesofar.com/ Jonathan King autobiography website] {{DEFAULTSORT:Everyone's Gone To The Moon}} [[Category:1965 songs]] [[Category:Songs written by Jonathan King]] [[Category:1965 singles]] [[Category:Decca Records singles]] [[Category:Parrot Records singles]] [[Category:Song recordings produced by Jonathan King]]
